div.p:
It is wonderful to me to feel
that I have so much left to love
after having lost so much and
often as I feel this with gra
titude gratitude to Heaven never did
I feel is more than on read
ing your most kind letter
dearest child, sister and friend

Well might my father say
Well did he prophecy, that
you dear as
then you were would be one
of the greatest blessings of my
life if prolonged to age -
God bless and preserve you
My dearest -- not merely
sel
fishly selfishly do I breathe this prayer
-- Lucy's account & Lestocks her
opinion of you are good and
for this I am thankful & hopeful

I am glad you will not each
yourself by driving or being
driven out till the weather is
finer and you stronger.

What a dreadful fire - The
200 year old Gresham Exchange
gone in a few hours - contents
of the iron chest and all!
I hope Lestock and his partners
will not suffer by it
either in Insurance or any
other way - I do not like to write
to trouble him with inquiries or
condolence -- I trust we shall hear
from you all that concerns him
-- He is to be with you on the 27h
I think-you need not plague
him with any question about
that old 13 draft - your mother
has had Hoare's account this
morning which has settled the
point no more about that -

I have gathered together all
the letters received since my last
Envoie which I think could
